articles.author: Sheila Dang
articles.description: Social media company X CEO Linda Yaccarino told employees that "data will tell the real story" about its efforts to battle antisemitism, according to a note to employees, amid growing outrage over the issue.
articles.title: X's CEO tells staff data will show efforts to fight hate, as advertisers flee

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The United Auto Workers union said Monday that 64% of workers at the Detroit Three automakers voted to ratify new contracts.
articles.title: UAW says 64% of workers vote to ratify Detroit Three contracts

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The U.S. Coast Guard on Monday said it was still looking for the source of a leak from an underwater pipeline off the Louisiana coast in the Gulf of Mexico that it estimated had released more than a million gallons of crude oil.
articles.title: US Coast Guard seeks source of some 1.1 million gallons of crude oil in Gulf of Mexico

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: President Volodymyr Zelenskiy met Fox Corp (FOXA.O) CEO Lachlan Murdoch in the Ukrainian capital in what Kyiv said on Monday was a "very important signal" of support at a time when global media attention has shifted from the war in Ukraine.
articles.title: Fox CEO Lachlan Murdoch meets Zelenskiy in Kyiv in 'very important signal' -Ukraine

articles.author: Paul Sandle
articles.description: Britain's antitrust regulator plans to tweak its merger assessment regime, including better interaction with the parties and letting remedies be pitched sooner, it said on Monday, after it was criticised over the Microsoft-Activision Blizzard deal.
articles.title: UK proposes changes to antitrust assessment after Microsoft-Activision case

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: U.S. robotaxi operators could face increased regulatory scrutiny after an accident involving Cruise, the self-driving cab business of General Motors (GM.N), forced the company to pause service.
articles.title: Explainer: GM-owned Cruise's wrong turn could slow robotaxi push

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: German industrial projects in jeopardy after a court ruling wiped 60 billion euros from the federal budget include chip factories, decarbonised steel production, and expanding the battery supply chain, two government sources said on Monday.
articles.title: German industrial projects in steel, chips, batteries at risk from court ruling -sources

articles.author: Stephanie Kelly, Jeffrey Dastin, Anna Tong
articles.description: OpenAI named ex-Twitch boss Emmett Shear as interim CEO, while outgoing chief Sam Altman is set to join backer Microsoft (MSFT.O) in a surprise turn of events for the startup at the heart of an artificial intelligence boom.
articles.title: OpenAI appoints new boss as Altman joins Microsoft in Silicon Valley twist

articles.author: Clauda Tanios, James Mackenzie
articles.description: Israeli tanks were positioned around a hospital complex in north Gaza where 12 Palestinians were killed and dozens wounded, the enclave's health ministry said on Monday as fighting raged on amid indications of an impending pause in hostilities.
articles.title: Israeli tanks reported near hospital in embattled north Gaza

articles.author: Mike Scarcella
articles.description: U.S. appeals court judges on Monday signaled skepticism toward Donald Trump's bid to overturn a gag order imposed on the former president in a federal criminal case in which he is accused of illegally trying to overturn his 2020 election defeat.
articles.title: Trump gag order appeal faces skeptical reception in US court
